content: Use BPI’s Padala remittance service. From abroad you can send via BPI Online or the BPI Mobile App by selecting “Send Money → Remittance to Philippines.” Enter your beneficiary’s BPI account number or choose cash pickup at any BPI/BPI Family branch. Fees start at USD 3.50 for amounts up to USD 500 and scale with the transfer size. Processing is real-time if sent to a BPI account and within 1 hour for cash pickup during banking hours.

response.message: How do I send money to Philippines through remittance?
response.translated_message:
Here's the translation:

"How do I send money to the Philippines through a remittance service?"

(Note: I kept the banking/financial context intact by using the term "remittance service" to maintain the original meaning of the text.)

suggestions.suggestion: Use BPI’s Padala remittance service. From abroad you can send via BPI Online or the BPI Mobile App by selecting “Send Money → Remittance to Philippines.” Enter your beneficiary’s BPI account number or choose cash pickup at any BPI/BPI Family branch. Fees start at USD 3.50 for amounts up to USD 500 and scale with the transfer size. Processing is real-time if sent to a BPI account and within 1 hour for cash pickup during banking hours.

Open a Pamana Padala account for your beneficiary. It has no maintaining balance requirement as long as you remit at least four times a year. The account also comes with free life insurance coverage equal to the average daily balance (up to Php 2 million) and earns regular savings interest. Your family can receive funds instantly when you send from overseas.

BPI applies live exchange rates at the time of remittance. For USD to PHP transfers, the rate is typically 0.30–0.50 PHP better than commercial money changers. You can lock in the rate displayed on the confirmation screen before final submission. Rates refresh every 30 seconds during market hours.

To enroll a beneficiary, you only need their full name, BPI account number (or mobile number for cash pickup), and relationship to you. No additional documents are required if you are already a BPI client. For first-time remitters, prepare one valid ID and proof of remittance source (e.g., payslip or employment contract).

Cut-off for same-day credit to BPI accounts is 11:00 p.m. Philippine time. Cash-pickup requests submitted before 3:00 p.m. are ready within 30 minutes; after 3:00 p.m., they are available the next banking day. Weekend and holiday transfers are queued for the next business day.

content: Can you help me with online banking setup?

Download the latest BPI Mobile App from Google Play or the App Store. Open the app, tap 'Register' (not 'Open an Account'—you already have #SaveUp), enter your #SaveUp account number and the 6-digit mobile PIN you created during account opening. You’ll receive an OTP via SMS to complete registration. After first login, set up your preferred username and password for future access.

response.message: Can you help me with online banking setup?
response.translated_message:
Here is the translation:

"Can you assist me with setting up online banking?"

I kept the banking/financial context intact by using the phrase "setting up online banking" to convey the same meaning as the original text.

suggestions.suggestion: Download the latest BPI Mobile App from Google Play or the App Store. Open the app, tap 'Register' (not 'Open an Account'—you already have #SaveUp), enter your #SaveUp account number and the 6-digit mobile PIN you created during account opening. You’ll receive an OTP via SMS to complete registration. After first login, set up your preferred username and password for future access.

Your #SaveUp Digital Savings account is automatically enrolled in BPI Online Banking. On the BPI Mobile App dashboard, you’ll see: (1) Real-time balance and transaction history, (2) 'Transfer Money' with InstaPay (₱50,000/transaction, ₱250,000/day) and PESONet (no limit), (3) 'Pay Bills' to 600+ billers with no fees, (4) 'Send Money' for remittances and QR Ph cash-in/cash-out. All features are accessible 24/7.

Go to 'Account Settings' (tap your profile icon) → 'Security Center'. Enable: (1) Biometric login (Face ID/fingerprint), (2) Mobile Key for OTP generation (works offline), (3) Real-time alerts via SMS and email under 'Notification Settings'. For business use, set up 'Trusted Devices' so only your phone and laptop can access the account.

Link your #SaveUp virtual debit card to Apple Pay or Google Pay: 'Cards' → select your card → 'Add to Wallet'. For supplier payments, use 'QR Ph' to generate a QR code they can scan to receive funds instantly. You can also create a 'QR Code Alias' (e.g., your business name) under 'QR Ph' → 'My QR' for repeat customers.

If locked out, use 'Forgot Password' on the login screen—OTP will be sent to your registered mobile. For app crashes, clear cache (Android: Settings → Apps → BPI → Storage → Clear Cache; iOS: offload and reinstall). For complex issues, tap 'Help & Support' → 'Chat with BOG' (24/7) or schedule a branch visit via 'BEA Online' inside the app.

content: Magkano ang minimum balance sa savings account?

Para sa iyong existing #SaveUp Digital Savings account, walang maintaining balance na kailangan—ito ay isa sa mga pangunahing tampok nito. Kung pinag-iisipan mo ang ibang BPI savings products, ang regular na BPI Passbook Savings at ATM Savings accounts ay karaniwang nangangailangan ng Php 3,000 daily balance para maiwasan ang service charges. Dahil mayroon ka nang #SaveUp, maaari mo itong panatilihing zero balance nang walang penalties.

response.message: Magkano ang minimum balance sa savings account?
response.translated_message:
Here's the translation:

"What is the minimum balance required for a savings account?"

(Note: "Magkano" is a Tagalog/Taglish word that means "how much" or "what amount", and "minimum balance" is a direct translation of "minimum balance" in English.)

suggestions.suggestion: Para sa iyong existing #SaveUp Digital Savings account, walang maintaining balance na kailangan—ito ay isa sa mga pangunahing tampok nito. Kung pinag-iisipan mo ang ibang BPI savings products, ang regular na BPI Passbook Savings at ATM Savings accounts ay karaniwang nangangailangan ng Php 3,000 daily balance para maiwasan ang service charges. Dahil mayroon ka nang #SaveUp, maaari mo itong panatilihing zero balance nang walang penalties.

Kung kailangan mo ng account na may check-writing capability para sa iyong business, ang BPI BizLink Checking Account ay may mas mataas na maintaining balance na Php 10,000 ngunit pinapayagan ang unlimited check writing at may kasamang libreng checkbook. Magandang kapareho ito ng iyong existing #SaveUp para sa paghihiwalay ng personal at business funds.

Maaari mong subaybayan ang iyong #SaveUp balance sa real-time sa pamamagitan ng BPI Mobile App. I-tap lamang ang 'Accounts' para makita ang iyong available balance at transaction history. Dahil walang maintaining balance, anumang halaga na iyong itatabi ay kumikita ng 0.0625% p.a. interest na kinikredito buwan-buwan.

content: Paano mag-transfer ng pera sa ibang bansa?

Para magpadala ng pera mula sa iyong BPI account papunta sa ibang bansa, gamitin ang BPI Online o BPI Mobile App. Sa app, piliin ang 'Send Money → Wire Transfer' o 'International Remittance'. Kailangan mong maghanda ng: (1) SWIFT/BIC code ng bangko ng tatanggap, (2) exact account number, (3) complete name at address ng beneficiary, at (4) purpose ng remittance. Ang processing fee ay nagsisimula sa Php 500-600 depende sa destination country at halaga. Processing time ay 1-3 banking days.

response.message: Paano mag-transfer ng pera sa ibang bansa?
response.translated_message:
Here's the translation:

"How do I transfer money to another country?"

(Note: The original text is a mix of Tagalog and English, which is commonly referred to as Taglish. I've translated it to clear English while keeping the original context intact.)

suggestions.suggestion: Para magpadala ng pera mula sa iyong BPI account papunta sa ibang bansa, gamitin ang BPI Online o BPI Mobile App. Sa app, piliin ang 'Send Money → Wire Transfer' o 'International Remittance'. Kailangan mong maghanda ng: (1) SWIFT/BIC code ng bangko ng tatanggap, (2) exact account number, (3) complete name at address ng beneficiary, at (4) purpose ng remittance. Ang processing fee ay nagsisimula sa Php 500-600 depende sa destination country at halaga. Processing time ay 1-3 banking days.

Kung mas madalas ka magpadala ng malalaking halaga para sa business mo, i-consider ang BPI Preferred Banking. May dedicated relationship manager na makakatulong sa mas mabilis na wire transfers at mas competitive na forex rates. Para mag-qualify, kailangan ng Php 500,000 average daily balance sa iyong BPI accounts.

Para sa mas mababang fees, i-check kung may correspondent banking relationship ang BPI sa bangko ng tatanggap. Halimbawa, sa US remittances, mas mura ang fees kung ang beneficiary ay may account sa Bank of America dahil sa partnership nila. Ang forex rate markup ay karaniwang 0.50-1.00% above BPI's selling rate.

content: What are the requirements for opening a savings account?

Since you already have a #SaveUp Digital Savings account, you’re familiar with the easiest entry point: zero initial deposit, zero maintaining balance, and fully online onboarding. If you’re exploring a second account, the Jumpstart Savings is purpose-built for students and young savers (no age cap mentioned), while the Maxi-Saver targets high-net-worth clients with premium features and higher earning potential. Both still require only one valid government ID and can be opened through the BPI Mobile App under ‘Open an Account’.

response.message: What are the requirements for opening a savings account?
response.translated_message:
Here is the translation:

"What are the requirements for opening a savings account?"

(Note: The translation is straightforward and maintains the original context, which is to inquire about the necessary requirements for opening a savings account.)

suggestions.suggestion: Since you already have a #SaveUp Digital Savings account, you’re familiar with the easiest entry point: zero initial deposit, zero maintaining balance, and fully online onboarding. If you’re exploring a second account, the Jumpstart Savings is purpose-built for students and young savers (no age cap mentioned), while the Maxi-Saver targets high-net-worth clients with premium features and higher earning potential. Both still require only one valid government ID and can be opened through the BPI Mobile App under ‘Open an Account’.

For any new BPI savings account—including #SaveUp, Jumpstart, or Maxi-Saver—you’ll need: (1) one primary government ID (passport, driver’s license, UMID, PRC ID) or two secondary IDs (postal ID, barangay clearance, company ID); (2) a 1×1 or 2×2 photo taken in-app; (3) signature captured on-screen; (4) initial deposit only if the product requires it (Php 0 for #SaveUp and Jumpstart; higher amounts for Maxi-Saver, exact figure not specified in the documents). The entire process is digital—no branch visit needed.

Current tiered offerings: (1) #SaveUp Digital Savings—zero initial deposit, zero maintaining balance, designed for first-time digital users; (2) Jumpstart Savings—student/young-saver focus, minimal financial commitment; (3) Maxi-Saver—premium tier for high-net-worth individuals, higher earning potential (exact rates not disclosed). All three can be opened online; only #SaveUp is available exclusively online for brand-new clients.

New-to-bank clients can open only the #SaveUp account online, creating a streamlined acquisition funnel. After that, you can open additional accounts (Jumpstart, Maxi-Saver, or others) through the same BPI Mobile App. Note that some post-opening services—like updating your mobile number or opening a different account type if you already hold a BPI credit card—still require a branch visit, reflecting BPI’s hybrid digital-physical model.

content: How can I apply for a credit card?

To apply for a BPI credit card, you must meet the minimum monthly income requirement for your chosen card tier. For the BPI Rewards Card, the minimum is Php 15,000/month, while the BPI Signature Card requires Php 180,000/month. You can apply online through the BPI website at https://www.bpi.com.ph/personal/cards/credit-cards or visit any BPI branch with your valid government ID, proof of income (latest ITR or payslips), and proof of billing address.

response.message: How can I apply for a credit card?

suggestions.suggestion: To apply for a BPI credit card, you must meet the minimum monthly income requirement for your chosen card tier. For the BPI Rewards Card, the minimum is Php 15,000/month, while the BPI Signature Card requires Php 180,000/month. You can apply online through the BPI website at https://www.bpi.com.ph/personal/cards/credit-cards or visit any BPI branch with your valid government ID, proof of income (latest ITR or payslips), and proof of billing address.

Based on your existing #SaveUp Digital Savings account and digital banking usage, I recommend starting with the BPI Rewards Card (Php 15,000/month income requirement). It earns 1 point per Php 35 spend, includes free travel insurance up to Php 2 million, and offers flexible installment terms. This aligns well with your digital-first banking approach and provides solid rewards without high income requirements.

The BPI Rewards Card offers 1 point per Php 35 spend with no cap mentioned, while the Signature Card provides enhanced rewards and premium privileges. Both cards allow point redemption for merchandise, travel, or cash credits. Current promotional offers may include waived annual fees for the first year - check the latest rates at https://www.bpi.com.ph/personal/cards/credit-cards/bpi-rewards-card

BPI frequently runs promotions with waived annual fees on select cards. The standard annual fees vary by card tier: BPI Rewards Card at Php 1,550/year, BPI Signature Card at Php 5,500/year. As of August 2025, updated fees and charges are in effect - review the complete fee schedule at https://www.bpi.com.ph/personal/cards/credit-cards/fees-and-charges

content: What loans do you offer for small businesses?

Para sa iyong small business, iniaalok ng BPI ang BPI SME Business Loan—isang term-loan facility na may loanable amount mula Php 500,000 hanggang Php 20 million, na maaaring bayaran sa loob ng 1–5 taon. Ang kasalukuyang indicative interest rate ay nagsisimula sa 6.25 % p.a. (subject to credit evaluation). Kinakailangan ang collateral—tumatanggap ng real-estate mortgage o deposit hold-out. Ang mga kailangang dokumento ay: latest Audited Financial Statements, latest ITR, business registration papers, at valid government IDs ng proprietor/partners. Ang processing fee ay 1 % ng loan amount. Ang target approval time ay 5–7 banking days kapag kumpleto na ang mga dokumento.

response.message: What loans do you offer for small businesses?

suggestions.suggestion: Para sa iyong small business, iniaalok ng BPI ang BPI SME Business Loan—isang term-loan facility na may loanable amount mula Php 500,000 hanggang Php 20 million, na maaaring bayaran sa loob ng 1–5 taon. Ang kasalukuyang indicative interest rate ay nagsisimula sa 6.25 % p.a. (subject to credit evaluation). Kinakailangan ang collateral—tumatanggap ng real-estate mortgage o deposit hold-out. Ang mga kailangang dokumento ay: latest Audited Financial Statements, latest ITR, business registration papers, at valid government IDs ng proprietor/partners. Ang processing fee ay 1 % ng loan amount. Ang target approval time ay 5–7 banking days kapag kumpleto na ang mga dokumento.

Kung kailangan mo naman ng revolving credit line sa halip na term loan, piliin ang BPI SME Credit Line. Nagbibigay ito ng standby credit mula Php 500,000 hanggang Php 5 million, na may interes na sisingilin lamang sa aktwal na nagamit na halaga (kasalukuyang rate 6.50 % p.a.). Ang credit line ay nirerepaso taon-taon at nangangailangan ng parehong collateral at dokumentaryong requirements gaya ng term loan. Ang opsyong ito ay angkop para sa cash-flow gaps at inventory purchases.

Para maging kwalipikado sa parehong produkto, kailangan: (1) ang negosyo ay nag-ooperate ng hindi bababa sa 2 taon, (2) minimum annual gross sales na Php 1 million, at (3) nasa mabuting credit standing sa BPI o ibang bangko. Kung mas mababa ang iyong annual sales sa Php 1 million, maaari kang mag-qualify sa BPI Ka-Negosyo Micro-Finance Loan—loanable amount hanggang Php 300,000, walang collateral, ngunit nangangailangan ng co-maker at 6-buwang cash-flow review.

Para sa BPI SME Business Loan, maaari kang pumili ng equal monthly amortizations (EMI) o straight-line payment structure na may balloon principal sa maturity. Pinapayagan ang maagang buong prepayment pagkatapos ng 12 buwan na may 3 % prepayment fee sa outstanding balance. Ang late-payment penalty ay 5 % bawat buwan sa anumang overdue amortization.

Ang standard processing ay 5–7 banking days para sa SME Business Loan at 3–5 banking days para sa SME Credit Line kapag kumpleto na ang set ng mga dokumento—DTI/SEC registration, latest ITR, audited financials, collateral titles, at valid IDs—na isinumite sa alinmang BPI branch o sa BPI Preferred online portal para sa business clients.

content: How do I send money to Philippines through remittance?

Gamitin ang BPI Online o BPI Mobile App. Piliin ang 'Send Money → To Another Local Bank' kung ang beneficiary ay may BPI/BPI Family Savings account; kung ibang bangko naman, pumili ng 'Send Money → To Other Banks via InstaPay o PESONet'. InstaPay (real-time, Php 50 fee) ang pinakamabilis para sa halagang hanggang Php 50,000 kada transaksyon; PESONet (same-day batch, Php 15-25 fee) para sa mas malalaking halaga. Siguraduhing tama ang account number at pangalan ng beneficiary.

response.message: How do I send money to Philippines through remittance?
response.translated_message:
Here's the translation:

"How do I send money to the Philippines through a remittance service?"

(Note: I kept the banking/financial context intact by using the term "remittance service" to maintain the original meaning of the text.)

suggestions.suggestion: Gamitin ang BPI Online o BPI Mobile App. Piliin ang 'Send Money → To Another Local Bank' kung ang beneficiary ay may BPI/BPI Family Savings account; kung ibang bangko naman, pumili ng 'Send Money → To Other Banks via InstaPay o PESONet'. InstaPay (real-time, Php 50 fee) ang pinakamabilis para sa halagang hanggang Php 50,000 kada transaksyon; PESONet (same-day batch, Php 15-25 fee) para sa mas malalaking halaga. Siguraduhing tama ang account number at pangalan ng beneficiary.

Kung ang beneficiary ay nasa Pilipinas at ikaw ay OFW, i-enroll ang iyong Pamana Padala account. Dahil waived ang minimum ADB requirement kapag may apat na remittances kada taon, mas kaunti ang kaltas sa iyong balanse. I-set up ang beneficiary sa BPI Online → Manage Beneficiaries → Add New; kailangan ng kanyang BPI 16-digit account number at mobile number para sa SMS notification.

Kung nagpapadala ka ng USD, EUR, o GBP pabalik sa PHP, ipapakita ng BPI Online ang real-time BPI foreign-exchange rate bago mag-confirm. Para sa mas malaking halaga, maaaring makakuha ng mas magandang rate sa BPI US Dollar Savings account conversion; mag-deposito muna sa USD account mo, pagkatapos ay i-convert sa PHP gamit ang FX rate sa loob ng app (libreng conversion, mas mataas ang rate kaysa over-the-counter).

Para sa InstaPay: Php 50 kada transaksyon hanggang Php 50,000. Para sa PESONet: Php 15-25 depende sa destination bank. Walang bayad kung ang beneficiary ay may BPI account at gagamitin mo ang 'Transfer to Own BPI Account' feature. Tandaan: may Php 250 fee kung mag-over-the-counter ka sa branch para sa same-day credit.

InstaPay: real-time, 24/7, kabilang ang weekends at holidays. PESONet: cut-off 3:30 PM para sa same-day credit; kung lampas, kinabukasan sa umaga. Para sa OFW na may time-zone difference, mag-schedule ng 'Future Dated Transfer' sa BPI Online (hanggang 30 araw ang advance) para siguraduhing nasa tamang oras ng Pilipinas darating ang pera.

Sa BPI Online → Manage Beneficiaries → Add Beneficiary, ilagay ang: (1) pangalan ng tatanggap, (2) BPI account number o ibang bank account number, (3) mobile number para sa SMS confirmation, at (4) email address. Para sa OFW na madalas magpadala, i-save ang beneficiary template para sa mabilis na repeat transactions. Siguraduhing naka-enroll ang mobile number ng beneficiary sa kanyang bangko para sa SMS credit advice.

content: Can you help me with online banking setup?

Download the latest BPI Mobile App (v2025.08.23) from Google Play or the App Store. Tap 'Register' → 'Enroll in BPI Online Banking'. Key in your 16-digit BPI ATM card number and 6-digit ATM PIN, then create a username and password. An OTP will be sent to your registered mobile number for verification. Once enrolled, you can instantly view balances, transfer funds, and open new accounts like #SaveUp Digital Savings or Jumpstart Savings directly in the app.

response.message: Can you help me with online banking setup?
response.translated_message:
Here is the translation:

"Can you assist me with setting up online banking?"

I kept the original meaning and context intact, while making the language more clear and concise.

suggestions.suggestion: Download the latest BPI Mobile App (v2025.08.23) from Google Play or the App Store. Tap 'Register' → 'Enroll in BPI Online Banking'. Key in your 16-digit BPI ATM card number and 6-digit ATM PIN, then create a username and password. An OTP will be sent to your registered mobile number for verification. Once enrolled, you can instantly view balances, transfer funds, and open new accounts like #SaveUp Digital Savings or Jumpstart Savings directly in the app.

With BPI Online Banking you can: (1) Transfer funds to any BPI/BPI Family account instantly and free, (2) Send money via InstaPay (real-time, Php 50 fee up to Php 50,000/txn) or PESONet (same-day batch, Php 15-25 fee), (3) Pay bills to 600+ merchants, (4) Open additional savings accounts (#SaveUp, Jumpstart, Maxi-Saver) in-app, (5) View credit-card statements and pay card bills, and (6) Apply for SME Business Loan up to Php 20 million.

Turn on biometric login (fingerprint or Face ID) in Account Settings. Activate real-time SMS and e-mail transaction alerts to monitor every debit or credit. Use the in-app 'Lock/Unlock Card' toggle if you misplace your debit or credit card. Never share your OTP or password—BPI will never ask for these via call, text, or e-mail.

Link your BPI debit or credit card to GCash, PayMaya, GrabPay, or ShopeePay for cashless payments. Generate a QR Ph code in the app to receive payments from other banks or e-wallets. For business, use 'Send Money → QR Ph' to pay suppliers or receive customer payments instantly.

If you cannot log in, tap 'Forgot Password' on the login screen and follow the reset link sent to your registered e-mail or mobile number. For app crashes, update to the latest version (v2025.08.23) then clear cache (Android) or force-close and restart (iOS). If issues persist, call BPI 24/7 Customer Care (+632) 889-10000 or message via the in-app 'Contact Us'.

content: Magkano ang minimum balance sa savings account?

Kung may existing kang #SaveUp Digital Savings account, wala itong maintaining balance requirement—zero pesos ang kailangan mong i-maintain. Para sa ibang BPI savings products tulad ng Jumpstart Savings o Maxi-Saver, maaaring may maintaining balance na Php 3,000 (Jumpstart) o Php 25,000 (Maxi-Saver) depende sa account type. Maaari mong i-check ang iyong specific account details sa BPI Mobile App → Accounts → View Details.

response.message: Magkano ang minimum balance sa savings account?
response.translated_message:
Here's the translation:

"What is the minimum balance required for a savings account?"

(Note: "Magkano" is a Tagalog/Taglish word that means "how much" or "what amount", and "minimum balance" is a direct translation of "minimum balance" in English.)

suggestions.suggestion: Kung may existing kang #SaveUp Digital Savings account, wala itong maintaining balance requirement—zero pesos ang kailangan mong i-maintain. Para sa ibang BPI savings products tulad ng Jumpstart Savings o Maxi-Saver, maaaring may maintaining balance na Php 3,000 (Jumpstart) o Php 25,000 (Maxi-Saver) depende sa account type. Maaari mong i-check ang iyong specific account details sa BPI Mobile App → Accounts → View Details.

Bukod sa #SaveUp na walang maintaining balance, may iba pang savings options: (1) Jumpstart Savings - para sa young professionals/students, may Php 3,000 maintaining balance; (2) Maxi-Saver - high-yield account na may Php 25,000 maintaining balance; (3) Regular Savings - standard account na may Php 3,000 maintaining. Lahat ng ito ay maaring buksan online gamit ang BPI Mobile App.

Para malaman ang eksaktong maintaining balance ng iyong account, mag-log in sa BPI Mobile App at piliin ang iyong savings account. Sa 'Account Details' section, makikita mo ang maintaining balance requirement at kung magkano ang current balance mo. Kung below maintaining balance ka, may monthly service charge na Php 300 para sa Regular Savings accounts.

content: Paano mag-transfer ng pera sa ibang bansa?

Para magpadala ng pera sa ibang bansa, gamitin ang BPI Online o BPI Mobile App. Piliin ang 'Send Money → Overseas Remittance' at piliin ang iyong preferred remittance partner tulad ng BPI Wire Transfer, Western Union, o MoneyGram. Kailangan mong maghanda ng SWIFT/BIC code ng beneficiary bank, exact account number, at complete address. Ang kasalukuyang processing fee ay mula USD 10–30 depende sa destination at urgency. Ang cut-off para same-day processing ay 3:00 PM (PH time) kung gusto mong ma-credit agad sa beneficiary account.

response.message: Paano mag-transfer ng pera sa ibang bansa?
response.translated_message:
Here's the translation:

"How do I transfer money to another country?"

(Note: The original text is a mix of Tagalog and English, which is commonly referred to as Taglish. I've translated it to clear English while keeping the original context intact.)

suggestions.suggestion: Para magpadala ng pera sa ibang bansa, gamitin ang BPI Online o BPI Mobile App. Piliin ang 'Send Money → Overseas Remittance' at piliin ang iyong preferred remittance partner tulad ng BPI Wire Transfer, Western Union, o MoneyGram. Kailangan mong maghanda ng SWIFT/BIC code ng beneficiary bank, exact account number, at complete address. Ang kasalukuyang processing fee ay mula USD 10–30 depende sa destination at urgency. Ang cut-off para same-day processing ay 3:00 PM (PH time) kung gusto mong ma-credit agad sa beneficiary account.

Ang BPI Wire Transfer ay may fixed fee na Php 500 kada transaction para sa mga major destinations tulad ng USA, Canada, at Europe. Para sa mas mabilis na InstaPay-enabled remittance (kung available sa destination), ang fee ay Php 150–250 kada Php 50,000 o katumbas. Siguraduhing tama ang beneficiary details dahil may Php 300 amendment fee kung may mali sa account information.

Kung kailangan mo ng mas personalized na tulong sa remittance setup, maaari kang tumawag sa BPI 24/7 Customer Service hotline (889-10000) o mag-book ng appointment sa pinakamalapit na BPI branch gamit ang BEA Online facility. Dalhin ang iyong valid ID at beneficiary details para sa mas mabilis na processing.
